lines.text: I'm every nightmare you've ever had. I'm your worst dream come true. I'm everything you ever were afraid of.
Kiss me, fat boy!
Hi, Georgie! Aren't cha gonna say... *hello*?
[shakes head]
Awww, come on bucko! Don't you want a... balloon?
I'm not supposed to take stuff from strangers; My dad said so.
Very wise of ya dad, Georgie - very wise indeed. I Georgie, am Pennywise the Dancin Clown- and you, are Georgie! So now we know each other! Keeerect?
I guess so... I gotta go.
Go? Without this?
[showing Georgie his fallen paper boat]

[cries out]
It's My Boat!
EEX-actly! Go on Kiddo... Take it.
[unsure about reaching into the storm drain for his boat]
Awww... You want it don't you Georgie? Hmm... Of course you do... and there's cotton candy, and rides, and all sorts of surprises down here... and balloons too... All colors.
Do they float?
[Georgie then reaches in for his boat]

[Pennywise's face begins changing from a smile to a frown]
Ohh yes... They Float Georgie... They Float... and when your down here, with me... YOU FLOAT TOO!
[Pennywise grabs Georgie's arm and pulls him toward the storm drain]
BEEP BEEP Richie! They ALL float down here. When you're down here with us, you'll float too!
Let go. Be afraid. You all taste so much better when you're afraid.
My dad says there's no way to date this one. He says it's probably from the early or mid 1700s when Derry was a logging town.
Hold it. P-P-P-Pennywise the clown?
That's him. That's him!
200 years ago? He was here then?
Come on, It's just a drawing.
Now look. Here he is again. The same man.
It's not a man.
It... IT!
[the scrapbook begins flapping]
Th-That's what happened back in Georgie's room.
[the scrapbook stops at a page and the picture comes to life. The kids see Pennywise dancing]
Look!

[Pennywise spots the kids]
GRRR!
[Pennywise climbs up to a lamp post and scares the kids]
I'll kill you all! Ha Ha! I'll drive you crazy and I'll kill you all! I'm every nightmare you've ever had! I am your worst dream come true! I'M EVERYTHING YOU EVER WERE AFRAID OF!

[Stan grabs the book and throws it]
NO!
YES!
Don't let it get to you man.
You saw it too.
I didn't want to.
But you did.
Yes. Okay. If that's what you want... Yes.
Yes, that's what I wanted, you turkey.
He thrusts his fists against the posts and still insists he sees the ghosts.
Kill It, Bev!
Kill!
[laughs]
Me? Oh you are priceless Brat! I am eternal, child. I am the eater of worlds, and of children. And you are next!
Swear to me. Swear to me that if it isn't dead, we'll all come back.
I swear.
Swear.
I swear it.
I swear.
I swear, too.
Swear.
Thanks.
Any time.
Who are you guys anyway?
We're sort of a club.
Yeah, the Losers Club.
Yeah.
You w-want in?
Yeah. Yeah, I do.
Excuse me, sir. Do you have Prince Albert in a can? You DO? Well, you better let the poor guy out! A-ha! A-ha! A-ha!
Excuse me, ma'am. Is your refrigerator running? *gasp* It IS? Well, you better go catch it before it runs away! A-ha! A-ha! A-ha!
What are we gonna do?
Do? What do you mean "Do"? I just want to forget about it.
It's not just us, it's all the other kids too. Like Velma Daniels, she was in my class. Who's gonna be next?
B-Bev's right, we gotta do something.
We gotta tell somebody.
They don't see what we see.
Why?
When you grow up, you stop believing.
They'd just laugh their heads off and put us in a nuthatch.
It kills kids Damn it!
We've gotta do something.

[after a long pause]
Help me. You killed my brother George, you bastard! Let's see you now. Let's see you now. It's scared of us you know? I can feel that. I swear to God I can. I... I wanna kill it. Help me. Please help me. Help me.
[the rest of The Lucky Seven embrace Bill in their circle]
What are you saying, Eddie? You're still a virgin?
Yeah.
Well I can't help you there, pal.
Want a balloon?
Audra, my brother who died...
Yes, George.
He didn't just die. He was muh-murdered.
Why didn't you ever...
Tell you? Because I forgot. Almost like it never happened. I know that this doesn't make any sense, but I have to go.
But why?
Because we made a pruh-promise.
Why are you stuttering like that?
I don't know. I used to stutter all the time when I was a kid.
I worry about you, Bevvie. Sometimes I worry a lot.
Don't talk. You're gonna be fine, Spaghetti-Man.
Richie, please. For the last time, don't call me that. You know how I...
You're too old to stop me! You're all too old.
So you Haystack, what are you building? A dam or something?
Yeah.
Have you ever built one before?
No
How do you know it will work?
Well of course it would why wouldn't it?
Yeah but how do you know?
I just know.
Yeah, he just knows.
Yeah.
Yeah.
Yeah.
Well, okay.

[Has a flashback]
I think I remember who Pennywise was now. Big White guy... Red nose... Bout 75 feet tall...
[Starts crying]
Mouth full of razor-sharp teeth?
Take your pick, B-b-b-Billy boy. Oh, except for the one on the end, that's already taken. Sorry.
I remember you, and I remember we beat you. I'm not afraid of you.
There's something terribly wrong here in Derry, and you know it!

[reading a paper]
He th-th-thrusts hi-his fists...

[takes the paper]
"He thrusts his fists against the posts and still insists he sees the ghosts." That's all it says, over and over.

[stuttering heavily]
My m-m-m-om g-gave me that to to to... sttttt! to help with my st-st-st-stutter!
No offense pal, it ain't workin'.
[Bill looks at him, and Richie blows him a kiss]

I just flew in from L.A., and boy is my tail-section tired... We're hot tonight, it's great to be back here in Derry, breathing in that old Derry Air. Eddie, get all of their names, I want to put them on my Christmas mailer, no, Denbrough there, let's put him on my Norman Mailer.
[He puts Eddie in a head-lock]
. I love this guy, he's like the brother I never had.
[Turns Eddie face-up]
. Wait a minute! He IS the brother I never had!
Beep beep Richie. Hello, Stan? Is this the Uris residence? I'm trying to get hold of Stan Uris... Oh... thank you. Thank you very much.
[hangs up telephone]
Stan is dead. He cut his wrists in the bathtub right after I phoned him.
I believe in Santa Claus. I believe in the Easter Bunny. I believe in the Tooth Fairy. But I don't believe in you. This is battery acid. Now, you disappear!
...If you want to see Henry Bowers, you'll find him up at Juniper Hills.
Ever since the trial where he confessed to all the murders of all the children.
He was down there with us, down there in the sewer.
That creep was going to kill Stan.
He was going to kill us all.
I remember when they pulled him out, his hair had turned white...
He was babbling about a bright light...
...and a clown.
And no one believed him.
Except when he said that he murdered all the kids.
One out of ten. You're worse than I am, kiddo. At this rate, we might as well let that damn clown take us one by one.
Beep beep Richie. Who's left? Ben? Bev?
Yeah, and one of them better be good, Bill, because right now, you're in the lead with a pathetic three out of ten.
Richie, will you PLEASE shut up?
You know you don't stutter all the time?
You're dead meat, fat boy.
Why does It have to be so mean?
Hello nigger. I'm here to pay you back. I'll pay you all back.
I hope that someone remembered to bring something useful, like a machine gun.

[holding up slingshot]
I brought this. It's the only thing I saved from those days.
I remember you were a dead shot, Bev.
Couldn't miss.
It was like it was supposed to be, Bev. Remember? You hit the clown, Pennywise, in the head. It broke open.
And underneath it was a light.
Bright lights.
Dead lights.
We'll have a home of our own one day, Benny, I promise.
I know, Mama.
Benny, as long as we're guests in this house, I need you to help me.
They wouldn't treat us like this if Daddy were still alive.
I need you to come inside now and apologize.
Apologize? But he was...
Benny, you must.
I hate it here! I hate it here!
[Climbs onto his bicycle]
Benny! Benny!
[Ben has just finished telling a story]
That's great, Ben. You should write that one down.
Bill's our writer.
I just write horror stories.

Listen, kids. This campfire stuff is fun, it really is, but it doesn't matter how painstakingly we go over these sewer plans or how many damn flashlights or helmets you've got in that box. When the sun comes up, I'm dust, and I would suggest that you follow me and get the hell out of Dodge!
S.S. Georgie, Mer Mer
The biggest mystery is how two hundred and fifty-three settlers just vanished without a trace.
I believe in Santa Claus. I believe in The Easter Bunny. I believe in the Tooth Fairy. But I dont believe in you. This is battery acid. And now you disappear.
I can get them, if they only half-believe. But you. You're alive, Henry. You can get them no matter if they believe, half-believe, or don't believe at all.
Couldn't It be just some crazy guy dressed up in a clown suit?
No, It's some kind of monster. And It's right here in Derry.

[Realizing that Mrs. Kersh is Pennywise in disguise]
It did say Marsh on the doorbell.

[Her voice becoming menacing]
If you're wise, you'll run dead, run... because to stay will mean worse than your death.
Oink, oink!

[Bill, Ben, Beverly and Eddie are about to go into the sewers to kill It]
Oh, come on guys. What the hell are you gonna do now? Sing Kumbaya? Wake up! Take a breath! Do you smell that? That's death. It's not for Stan. It's not for Mike. It's not for Henry Bowers. It's for us. It's in the air. Losers fight It, losers die And you know that, don't you Captain?
